diagnosis.score_summary: L'Oréal Paris Infallible scores a high 82%, showing strong alignment on core product attributes and visual identity. However, a critical fracture exists in the brand's soul: the WWW site sells 'Empowerment' (Why) while the Marketplace sells 'Polymers' (How), creating a jarring disconnect between emotional uplift and mechanical maintenance.

truth_1.headline: Inspiration vs. Insulation
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW signals 'The Empowerer' (Origin: Self-Worth). The PDP signals 'The Guardian' (Origin: Clinical Lab). You are selling a psychological transformation on your site and a chemical barrier on Amazon.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'Because You're Worth It' (Empowerment) vs. PDP: 'Lock In / Prevent Cracking' (Maintenance)
truth_1.why_matters: When the 'Why' changes from 'Worth' to 'Polymers,' the brand authority collapses. The user doesn't know if they are buying confidence or just industrial glue.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are split between being a Guru and a Chemist. You must choose: either strip the emotional 'Worth It' halo from the site to match the hard-nosed utility of the Marketplace (Option A), or infuse the Amazon content with the 'Empowerment' narrative to justify the brand premium (Option B). You cannot price emotional liberation at the same rate as a chemical fix.

truth_2.headline: The Catalog vs. The Classroom
truth_2.gap_description: WWW relies on 'Hard Product Sell' (Intent 4/5). PDP relies on 'Science Education' (Intent 2/5). Your direct channel assumes the sale, while your partner channel explains the science.
truth_2.evidence: WWW: 'Buy Online' (Transactional) vs. PDP: 'Molecular Lattice Diagrams' (Educational)
truth_2.why_matters: Your own website is failing to educate the user on the 'Microfine' USP, leaving that heavy lifting to Amazon. This makes your DTC site feel shallow compared to the 'Pro' depth of the marketplace listing.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: You are treating your home base as a vending machine and Amazon as a university. The data demands a shift: either dumb down Amazon to a transactional shelf to speed up conversion (Option A), or upgrade the WWW product pages with the molecular science depth found on the PDP to build true authority (Option B). Expertise that only lives on a partner site is expertise you do not own.

truth_3.headline: The Professor vs. The Manual
truth_3.gap_description: WWW signals 'Clinical Authority' (Distant). PDP signals 'Modern Minimalist' (Instructional). The website speaks *at* the user with prestige; Amazon speaks *to* the user with instructions.
truth_3.evidence: WWW: 'Beauty Genius' (Status) vs. PDP: 'Spray in circular motion' (Utility)
truth_3.why_matters: The tone gap creates a personality disorder. The user feels spoken down to on the site but coached on Amazon. This inconsistency dilutes the 'Professional' positioning.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: You are oscillating between a prestige lecture and a utility manual. You must decide: either elevate the Amazon copy to 'Clinical Authority' to maintain the premium masstige aura (Option A), or humble the Global site to 'Modern Minimalist' to align with the helpful reality of the product usage (Option B). You cannot be a distant expert and a helpful buddy simultaneously.

truth_4.headline: The Ruler is Losing Control
truth_4.gap_description: WWW asserts 'The Ruler' archetype (60%)—commanding and static. PDP shifts to 'The Hero' (60%)—active and conquering ('Defy,' 'Infallible'). The Marketplace is aggressive; the Brand is passive.
truth_4.why_matters: The 'Hero' energy on Amazon is likely converting better because it implies active warfare against makeup failure. The 'Ruler' on WWW feels arrogant and static by comparison.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon listing is fighting a war ('Defy Transfer') while your website is sitting on a throne ('Infallible'). Active verbs sell better than static nouns. You must choose: either tone down the aggression on Amazon to preserve the regal brand code (Option A), or update the global identity to 'The Hero' and start fighting for the user's look everywhere (Option B). A Ruler demands respect; a Hero earns it.

truth_5.headline: The Miracle is Clearer on Amazon
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels aim for 'The Scientific Miracle' (Positioning), but Amazon visualizes it with 'Molecular Lattices' and 'Clock Icons' while WWW relies on text. The Marketplace is executing the visual promise of the science better than the home base.
truth_5.evidence: Visual Evidence: PDP (Molecular Diagrams) > WWW (Static Product Shots)
truth_5.why_matters: Your 'Pro-Inspired' claim is validated by the diagrams on Amazon. The lack of these assets on WWW makes the 'Pro' claim feel like marketing fluff rather than technical reality.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: Amazon is proving the science while your website is merely claiming it. You face a choice: either remove the complex diagrams from Amazon to simplify the shopping experience (Option A), or deploy the 'Molecular Lattice' assets to the WWW site to substantiate the 'Scientific Miracle' positioning (Option B). Claims without diagrams are just poetry.

marker_1.so_what: WWW sells self-worth; PDP sells polymer chemistry. The soul of the brand is fractured.

marker_2.so_what: Both channels perfectly align on the mission to democratize professional results ($13 vs $11).

marker_3.so_what: The commitment to 'Infallible' performance over ingredient transparency is consistent across the board.

marker_4.so_what: Strong alignment on the 'Masstige' promise, though WWW attempts to push the value perception slightly higher.

marker_5.so_what: The brand voice remains consistent: low warmth, high competence. It acts as an expert in both spaces.

marker_6.so_what: Both are Performers, but WWW commands (Ruler) while PDP fights (Hero). This changes the energy from static to active.

marker_7.so_what: WWW creates distance with 'Clinical' formality; PDP closes the gap with 'Helpful' instruction. A distinct tone shift.

marker_8.so_what: Visuals are tightly aligned to 'Pharma-Code' with red accents. PDP enhances this with more diagrams.

marker_9.so_what: Both channels hook with the Result (36H Wear) and persuade with Rational logic. No poetry, just facts.

marker_10.so_what: The story is consistently about 'The Lab' solving the problem, with no human protagonist visible.

marker_11.so_what: Both rely on 'Pro-Inspired' and 'Dermatologist Tested' as the core validators.

marker_12.so_what: The unique selling proposition is the engineering of the 'Microfine Mist' format, not an ingredient.

marker_13.so_what: WWW is trying to close the deal; PDP is trying to teach the class. A major strategic disconnect.

marker_14.so_what: WWW implies a 'Fixer' role (Action 4) while PDP implies a 'Shield' role (Action 1). Confusion on mechanism.

marker_15.so_what: Consistently selling 'Savvy' confidence—the feeling of being smart for choosing a pro product.

marker_16.so_what: The brand consistently appeals to the rational user who wants the 'Smart Choice' over the luxury status symbol.

marker_17.so_what: Both channels leverage mass adoption ('Best Seller') to signal safety in numbers.
